title: Angular momentum - student jumps rotating platform

content.question: A student with mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> runs and jumps onto the outer edge of a stationary horizontal platform that is free to rotate about an axis at the center of the platform. The platform has mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and rotational inertia <math alttext="one half uppercase M, R squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Immediately before landing on the platform the student has horizontal speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> directed tangentially to the outer edge of the platform. Which of the following is equal to the angular momentum of the student about the platformâ€™s axis immediately before landing on the platform?
